content:
Cesium is primarily written in JavaScript and uses WebGL to render 3D graphics in the browser. However, Cesium's JavaScript API can be used in conjunction with other programming languages and frameworks to build web applications.

While Cesium itself cannot be translated to Golang, it is possible to build a web platform using Golang and incorporate Cesium's JavaScript API for 3D visualization and interaction. The Golang server can provide the necessary data and logic for the web application, while the Cesium JavaScript API can handle the visualization and interaction with the 3D models and the globe.

To accomplish this, you can use a web framework such as Echo, Gin, or Revel to build the backend using Golang. The backend can then provide data and services to the frontend, which would be built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The Cesium JavaScript API can be incorporated into the frontend to handle the 3D visualization and interaction with the globe.

This approach can provide a robust and efficient web platform that leverages both the power of Golang for the backend and the capabilities of Cesium for the frontend.
